structure.unit: ESCAPE AND OTHER OFFENSES RELATING TO CUSTODY

text.section: A person is guilty of escape in the first degree when he escapes from custody or a detention facility by the use of force or threat of force against another person.
Escape in the first degree is a Class C felony.

law.history: Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 406, sec. 170, effective January 1, 1975.
